title: thunderbird reply
content:
Something has changed in the way Thunderbird is handling Replies. Replies used to be added to the original email with an arrow indicating that the email had been responded to. Now the reply is added to the mail list as a separate email grossly clogging up the list of emails. Sometimes the "replay arrow" is displayed and sometimes not. I do not want the reply shown as a separate email. Is there some setting that will accomplish this? I have been unable to find anything that looks like it would work.

PS The Bold and Italic for this email did not work.
creator: wrangler53

title: Thunderbird weigert sich, mein Passwort für meinen E-Mail-Account zu speichern.
content:
Hallo!

Leider weigert sich Thunderbird meine Passwortpräferenzen zu speichern.

Ich muss nun bei jedem Start mein Passwort eingeben. Ich habe bei jeder Eingabe auch das Kästchen angeklickt, dass Thunderbird doch bitte mein Passwort mit dem integrierten Passwortmanager speichern soll. Nachdem ich es eingegeben habe und erfolgreich eingeloggt bin, sehe ich, dass Thunderbird es aber nicht abspeichert, denn unter "Datenschutz und Sicherheit" -> "Passwörter" wird kein gespeichertes Passwort angezeigt.

Ich verwende die aktuellste Version (habe ich bei "Über Thunderbird" kontrolliert). Ich verwende kein CCleaner. Mein OS ist Windows 10. Mein Posteingang funktioniert normal und ich kann meine E-Mails sehen und neue versenden.

Wie kann ich das Problem bitte beheben?
creator: fg.thunderbirdhilfe

title: Email account niet bereikbaar op server
content: Is het mogelijk om de settings van een email account (tijdelijk) in te stellen op 'Niet vragen naar nieuwe email'. Dit om de melding te voorkomen dat de mail server van de provider niet beschikbaar is. (Ik zit nu in het proces van overstap naar een ander mail provider. Volgens mij kan ik de account niet verwijderen zonder dat ook de mail-historie wordt verwijderd.) Dank voor je suggestie. Paul
creator: ppstruc

title: Thunderbird hängt sich auf/crasht, wenn ich versuche meinen Gmail-Account zu verknüpfen
content:
Hallo liebe Helfer!

Ich versuche gerade meinen Gmail-Account bei Thunderbird zu registrieren. Leider schlägt dies aktuell fehl.

Nachdem ich meine Zugangsdaten eingegeben habe und im aufpoppenden Browser Google bestätigt habe, dass Thunderbird Zugriff auf meine Google-Daten haben soll, sagt das dann wieder aufploppende Thunderbird oben auf dem Bildschirm, dass "das Passwort geprüft wird" und unten links auf dem Bildschirm steht "die Zugangsdaten werden an Google gesendet" oder so ähnlich.

Danach passiert gar nichts mehr. Ich bekomme keine Fehlermeldung und keine Nachricht, dass irgendetwas schief gelaufen ist oder dass eine falsche Eingabe vorliegt. Ich habe 20 Minuten gewartet, aber es tut sich nichts.

Danach habe ich das Programm versucht zu schließen, aber dies ging nicht, weil es sich aufgehangen hat, beziehungsweise es ist gecrashed. Ich musste Thunderbird dann manuell über den Task Manager beenden, weil es auch nach wiederholten versuchen es normal zu schließen, nicht reagiert hat.

Hiernach habe ich die gleiche Registrierung nochmal versucht. Leider kam genau das Gleiche dabei raus.

Die Registrierungsanfrage scheint bei Google aber auch anzukommen. Ich bekomme die Sicherheitsbenachrichtigung für mein Einloggen nämlich in meiner Mail-App angezeigt. Bei Google kann man die "Aktivität prüfen", wenn man glaubt, dass der Einloggeversuch nicht von einem selbst ist, aber hier war ich es ja. Angeklickt habe ich dort also nichts, so dass es daran auch nicht liegen kann.

Wäre jemand so nett mir hier weiterzuhelfen? Ich weiß nicht, was ich noch machen kann, um die Accounts zu verknüpfen/bei Thunderbird zu registrieren.
creator: fg.thunderbirdhilfe

title: Thunderbird refuses to save my password for my e-mail account.
content:
[I have originally asked this question in German, this is the English translation]

Hello!

Unfortunately Thunderbird refuses to save my password preferences.

I now have to enter my password every time I start it. Each time I enter it, I have also checked the box asking Thunderbird to save my password using the integrated password manager. After I have entered it and logged in successfully, I see that Thunderbird does not save it, because no saved password is displayed under “Privacy and security” -> “Passwords”.

I am using the latest version (I checked under “About Thunderbird”). I do not use CCleaner. My OS is Windows 10, my inbox works normally and I can see my emails and send new ones.

How can I fix the problem please?
creator: fg.thunderbirdhilfe

title: Oauth2 authentication fails when I try to link my Gmail account
content:
[I have originally asked this question in German, this is the English translation] https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1485473

Hello dear helpers!

I am currently trying to register my Gmail account with Thunderbird. Unfortunately, this is currently failing.

After I have entered my access data and confirmed in the Google browser that pops up that Thunderbird should have access to my Google data, the Thunderbird that pops up again says at the top of the screen that “the password is being checked” and at the bottom left of the screen it says “the access data is being sent to Google” or something similar.

After that, nothing happens. I get no error message and no message that anything has gone wrong or that there is an incorrect entry. I have waited 20 minutes, but nothing happens.

Then I tried to close the program, but this didn't work because it hung up or crashed. I then had to close Thunderbird manually via the Task Manager because it didn't respond even after repeated attempts to close it normally.

I then tried the same registration again. Unfortunately, the result was exactly the same.

The registration request also seems to be received by Google. I get the security notification for my login in my mail app. Google allows you to “Check activity” if you believe that the login attempt is not yours, but here it was me. I didn't click on anything there, so that can't be the reason.

Would someone be so kind as to help me here? I don't know what else I can do to link the accounts/register them with Thunderbird.
creator: fg.thunderbirdhilfe

title: cant creat new folder
content:
peculiar problem, my wife's installation of Thunderbird seems to be corrupt somehow. she cannot make a new folder or subfolder, when you right click the option to create a new folder is not even there, the only way is file/new/folder but nothing happens...now that was weird enough but since this started we have both got new machines with a new installation of windows 11 and a new installation of thunderbird and yet the wife still has the same problem, we did import the profile from the old hard drive so could the problem have been imported with the profile.

I have changed a thousand settings from various help pages, I can program, build and repair PCs, and I run my own dedicated server so I am not a noob.

it seems that something somewhere is restricting the right-click menus and the facility to create folders and subfolders. HHHHEEEEEEEELLLLPPPP
creator: tony284

title: Moving archived folders off line to my PCs hard drive
content:
Hi All,

I tried searching for an answer to this with terms like "offline storage" or "moving archived folders" and I found some topics that were close, but did not really answer the question or did not have the detail I needed.

For one of my TB email accounts I have a lot of subfolders for each year, going back for many years. For example, I have a "archive 2017" folder, and so on. Is there a way I can remove these archived folders to my local hard drive so they are not taking space on my server, but that I can still access them easily if needed?

I don't know if it matters, but I use IMAP settings/server.

If there is a solution, please provide as many steps and details as possible.

Thanks everyone, 

  Bill
creator: sales375

title: Problems syncing google shared calendars since upgrading to thunderbird 128.6.0esr
content:
Hi,

Since upgrading to thunderbird 128.6.0esr, my shared google calendars no longer show any events.

The activity manager shows it is stuck trying to sync, but not going anywhere.

Onn checking the developer logs, the following messages are displayed.

Anybody else having this problem or know of a solution. (I have removed "CALDAV" and "TB SYNC" extensions - also installed "TB SYNC 4")

Thanks Paul

Developer Logs: 15:25:05.693 Calendar: XPCWrappedNative_NoHelper { QueryInterface: QueryInterface(), result: Getter, message: Getter, ERROR: 1, INTERNAL: 2, PERM: 3, ABORT: 4, BUSY: 5, LOCKED: 6, NOMEM: 7, … }


CalStorageDatabase.sys.mjs:247:15


15:25:05.696 [calCachedCalendar] replay action failed: <unknown>, uri=googleapi://????????/?calendar=???????, result=error executing async statement, operation=[xpconnect wrapped calIOperation]

title: Account Security Exception fails - can not open account
content: This issue started to appear 2-3 weeks ago. It appeared on my three ‘smtp.mail.yahoo.com’ (aka, @cox.com) accounts when I was attempting to send a message. The ‘Permanently store this exception’ worked and the messages ceased. My other account: pop3.mailfence.com with smtp.mailfence.com began having the same issue except the “Permanently store this except” function fails to work. At first, only sending (smtp) was failing. Now, I can no longer even access the account without the message (included) being displaying. I am aware that Norton is involved from viewing the certificate information . Yes, I use Norton 360 and have for decades. I have, also, been on the TB support site (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/thunderbird) and found similar issues. Unfortunately, none of them seem to address this specific issue. Thank you in advance for your time and effort. Roger
creator: AvidResearcher

title: Thunderbird Will Not Load
content:
I am currently using Thunderbird (128.6.0esr) on a Mac with OS Sonoma (14.7.1). I have used Thunderbird for many years with a Gmail account on both Windows and Mac machines, and it has always worked well.

But a couple of days ago when I tried to open Thunderbird it went into some kind of loop. The MacOS spinning beach ball appeared and would not go away no matter what I did or how long I waited. The only way out was to Force Quit Thunderbird. Rebooting the Mac and trying again produced the same results.

I have logged into the Gmail account on the web and had no trouble accessing it. But every time (and I have made many attempts) I try to load Thunderbird the spinning beach ball appears again.

I cannot check any of the various settings that Help articles have suggested checking since Thunderbird will not load at all.

If anyone can suggest how to resolve my problem, I would greatly appreciate it.
creator: charlesvaughn693

title: TB slow in deleting messages
content:
This is an odd one I've not encountered before. I have TB installed on 2 laptops at home. They are up-to-date with 128.6.0 installed, and both are using the same wi-fi system.

All of a sudden a few days ago, TB on one of the laptops, but not the other, became noticeably slow in deleting messages. It now takes a few seconds for what before always happened instantly (and still does on the other laptop).

Not the end of the world but it's annoying and I'm hoping there's an easy fix.

Thanks for any help.

Andrew
